lifecycle","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}]},"events":{"HardwareAudited(string,address,bool)":{"params":{"auditor":"Address of the auditing entity","passed":"Whether hardware integrity passed inspection","serialNumber":"Unique identifier of the netbook"}},"NetbookAssigned(string,bytes32,bytes32)":{"params":{"schoolHash":"Hash of the school identifier (protects PII)","serialNumber":"Unique identifier of the netbook","studentHash":"Hash of the student identifier (protects PII)"}},"NetbookRegistered(string,string,address)":{"params":{"batchId":"Production batch identifier","manufacturer":"Address of the registering manufacturer","serialNumber":"Unique identifier of the netbook"}},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"SoftwareValidated(string,address,string)":{"params":{"osVersion":"Operating system version installed","serialNumber":"Unique identifier of the netbook","technician":"Address of the validating technician"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"assignToStudent(string,bytes32,bytes32,string)":{"custom:emits":"NetbookAssigned event with assignment detailsTraceabilityDataUpdated event with assignment metadata","custom:postcondition":"Netbook state advances to DISTRIBUIDA with timestamp","custom:precondition":"Netbook must exist and be in SW_VALIDADO state","custom:role":"ESCUELA_ROLE","details":"Transitions netbook from SW_VALIDADO to DISTRIBUIDA stateOnly accounts with ESCUELA_ROLE can call this function","params":{"metadata":"JSON string with additional assignment data","schoolHash":"Cryptographic hash of the school identifier (protects PII)","serial":"Unique serial number of the netbook to assign","studentHash":"Cryptographic hash of the student identifier (protects PII)"}},"auditHardware(string,bool,bytes32,string)":{"custom:emits":"HardwareAudited event with audit detailsTraceabilityDataUpdated event with audit metadata","custom:postcondition":"Netbook state advances to HW_APROBADO","custom:precondition":"Netbook must exist and be in FABRICADA state","custom:role":"AUDITOR_HW_ROLE","details":"Transitions netbook from FABRICADA to HW_APROBADO state if successfulOnly accounts with AUDITOR_HW_ROLE can call this function","params":{"metadata":"JSON string with additional hardware audit data","passed":"Whether the hardware integrity passed inspection","reportHash":"Cryptographic hash of the complete audit report (stored off-chain)","serial":"Unique serial number of the netbook to audit"}},"getAllMembers(bytes32)":{"custom:security":"Uses AccessControl's built-in enumeration functions","custom:view":"This function does not modify state","params":{"role":"The role identifier to data"}},"getNetbookState(string)":{"custom:requirements":"Netbook must exist in the system","params":{"serial":"Unique serial number of the netbook"},"returns":{"_0":"currentState The current state in To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleByName(string)":{"custom:deprecated":"Usa constantes de roles directamente en su lugar","details":"Este funci\u00f3n esta deprecada y ser\u00e1 removida en futuras versiones","params":{"roleType":"El nombre del rol (\"FABRICANTE\", \"AUDITOR_HW\", \"TECNICO_SW\", \"ESCUELA\")"},"returns":{"_0":"role El hash del rol correspondiente"}},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"getRoleMembers(bytes32)":{"details":"Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block."},"getSerialNumber(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"El ID del token"},"returns":{"_0":"El n\u00famero de serie"}},"getTokenId(string)":{"params":{"serialNumber":"El n\u00famero de serie"},"returns":{"_0":"El ID del token"}},"getTokenMetadata(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"El ID del token"},"returns":{"_0":"El string JSON con los metadata"}},"registerNetbooks(string[],string[],string[],string[])":{"custom:emits":"NetbookRegistered event for each registered netbookNetbookRegistered event for each registered netbookTraceabilityDataUpdated event with initial data","custom:role":"FABRICANTE_ROLEFABRICANTE_ROLE","details":"Only accounts with FABRICANTE_ROLE can call this functionOnly accounts with FABRICANTE_ROLE can call this function","params":{"batches":"Array of batch identifiers corresponding to each netbook","metadata":"Array of JSON metadata strings for each netbook","serials":"Array of unique serial numbers for the netbooks","specs":"Array of initial model specifications for each netbook"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"custom:role":"DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE","details":"Only the admin can call this function","params":{"account":"The account to revoke the assignToStudent(string,bytes32,bytes32,s.custom:emits: NetbookAssigned event with assignment detailsTraceabilityDataUpdated event with assignment metadata
assignToStudent(string,bytes32,bytes32,s.custom:postcondition: Netbook state advances to DISTRIBUIDA with timestamp
assignToStudent(string,bytes32,bytes32,s.custom:precondition: Netbook must exist and be in SW_VALIDADO state
assignToStudent(string,bytes32,bytes32,s.details: Transitions netbook from SW_VALIDADO to DISTRIBUIDA stateOnly accounts with ESCUELA_ROLE can call this function

params.metadata: JSON string with additional assignment data
params.schoolHash: Cryptographic hash of the school identifier (protects PII)
params.serial: Unique serial number of the netbook to assign
params.studentHash: Cryptographic hash of the student identifier (protects PII)

auditHardware(string,bool,bytes32,string.custom:emits: HardwareAudited event with audit detailsTraceabilityDataUpdated event with audit metadata
auditHardware(string,bool,bytes32,string.custom:precondition: Netbook must exist and be in FABRICADA state
auditHardware(string,bool,bytes32,string.details: Transitions netbook from FABRICADA to HW_APROBADO state if successfulOnly accounts with AUDITOR_HW_ROLE can call this function

params.metadata: JSON string with additional hardware audit data
params.passed: Whether the hardware integrity passed inspection
params.reportHash: Cryptographic hash of the complete audit report (stored off-chain)
params.serial: Unique serial number of the netbook to audit

getAllMembers(bytes32).custom:view: This function does not modify state

returns._0: members Array of addresses that have the specified role

getAllSerialNumbers().custom:view: This function does not modify state

returns._0: serials Array of all netbook serial numbers in the system

getNetbookReport(string).custom:requirements: Netbook must exist in the system
getNetbookReport(string).custom:security: All PII is stored as cryptographic hashes for privacy

params.serial: Unique serial number of the netbook

returns._0: report The complete netbook record with all lifecycle data

getNetbookState(string).custom:requirements: Netbook must exist in the system

params.serial: Unique serial number of the netbook

returns._0: currentState The current state in the supply chain lifecycle

getNetbooksByState(uint8).custom:efficiency: Linear time complexity O(n) where n is the number of netbooks
getNetbooksByState(uint8).custom:view: This function does not modify state

returns._0: serials Array of serial numbers for netbooks in the specified state

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleByName(string).custom:deprecated: Usa constantes de roles directamente en su lugar
getRoleByName(string).details: Este funcin esta deprecada y ser removida en futuras versiones

returns._0: role El hash del rol correspondiente

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

returns._0: El string JSON con los metadata

registerNetbooks(string[],string[],strin.custom:emits: NetbookRegistered event for each registered netbookNetbookRegistered event for each registered netbookTraceabilityDataUpdated event with initial data
registerNetbooks(string[],string[],strin.details: Only accounts with FABRICANTE_ROLE can call this functionOnly accounts with FABRICANTE_ROLE can call this function

params.batches: Array of batch identifiers corresponding to each netbook
params.metadata: Array of JSON metadata strings for each netbook
params.serials: Array of unique serial numbers for the netbooks
params.specs: Array of initial model specifications for each netbook

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Only the admin can call this function

params.account: The account to revoke the role from

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Overrides supportsInterface to satisfy multiple inheritance

totalNetbooks().custom:view: This function does not modify state

returns._0: count The total number of netbooks in the system

validateSoftware(string,string,bool,stri.custom:emits: SoftwareValidated event with validation detailsTraceabilityDataUpdated event with validation metadata
validateSoftware(string,string,bool,stri.custom:precondition: Netbook must exist and be in HW_APROBADO state
validateSoftware(string,string,bool,stri.details: Transitions netbook from HW_APROBADO to SW_VALIDADO state if successfulOnly accounts with TECNICO_SW_ROLE can call this function

params.metadata: JSON string with additional software validation data
params.osVersion: Version of the operating system installed
params.serial: Unique serial number of the netbook to validate

AUDITOR_HW_ROLE().notice: Role for hardware auditors to verify physical integrity

ESCUELA_ROLE().notice: Role for schools to assign netbooks to students

FABRICANTE_ROLE().notice: Role for manufacturers to register new netbooks

TECNICO_SW_ROLE().notice: Role for software technicians to validate installed software

assignToStudent(string,bytes32,bytes32,s.notice: Assigns a netbook to a student

auditHardware(string,bool,bytes32,string.notice: Performs hardware audit on a netbookPerforms hardware audit on a netbook

getAllMembers(bytes32).notice: Gets all accounts that have been granted a specific role

getNetbookReport(string).notice: Gets the complete tracking report for a netbook

getNetbookState(string).notice: Gets the current state of a netbook

getNetbooksByState(uint8).notice: Gets all netbooks in a specific state

getRoleByName(string).notice: Obtiene el hash del rol por su nombre

getSerialNumber(uint256).notice: Obtiene el nmero de serie para un ID de token

getTokenId(string).notice: Obtiene el ID del token para un nmero de serie

getTokenMetadata(uint256).notice: Obtiene el metadata asociado a un token

registerNetbooks(string[],string[],strin.notice: Registers new netbooks in the supply chainRegisters new netbooks in the supply chain

revokeRole(bytes32,address).notice: Revokes a role from an account

serialToTokenId(string).notice: Complete tracking record for a netbook throughout its supply chain lifecycle

totalNetbooks().notice: Gets the total number of registered netbooks

validateSoftware(string,string,bool,stri.notice: Validates software installation on a netbook
